text:
Today, I introduced bipartisan legislation with Rep. Collin Peterson (MN) to repeal the Federal Excise Tax (FET) on heavy-duty trucks. The #FET is outdated, unnecessary, & prohibitive - and it's time to get rid of it.

html: (3/4) Any newborn baby, regardless of whether that baby survived an abortion or not, deserves a fighting chance at life. We rigorously protect against the destruction of animal wildlife but simultaneously allow for the murder of live newborn infants?

html: (4/4) The situation at the southern border is a humanitarian and national security crisis, and it’s a national emergency. The stubborn opposition to a regulated border is incomprehensible and endangers American citizens.
text: (4/4) The situation at the southern border is a humanitarian and national security crisis, and it’s a national emergency. The stubborn opposition to a regulated border is incomprehensible and endangers American citizens.

html: (3/4) I’ve been working with the White House to ensure funding for disaster recovery and critical civil works projects, such as levees and water storage, are not affected by a shift in funding in this process.
text: (3/4) I’ve been working with the White House to ensure funding for disaster recovery and critical civil works projects, such as levees and water storage, are not affected by a shift in funding in this process.

html: (2/4) This decision is not without precedent – there have been nearly 60 national emergencies declared by U.S. Presidents since 1976. Similarly, previous governors of New Mexico and Arizona have also declared states of emergency along the border in the past.
text: (2/4) This decision is not without precedent – there have been nearly 60 national emergencies declared by U.S. Presidents since 1976. Similarly, previous governors of New Mexico and Arizona have also declared states of emergency along the border in the past.

html: #WOTUS was nothing short of a job-killing Washington power grab, and I’m glad to see it replaced with something that works.
text: #WOTUS was nothing short of a job-killing Washington power grab, and I’m glad to see it replaced with something that works.

html: Now, those driving our economy will spend less time & money on land-use decisions & litigation & more time running their business. States will finally have a clear definition of where federal jurisdiction ends & begins, as well as the ability to properly manage their own water.
text: Now, those driving our economy will spend less time & money on land-use decisions & litigation & more time running their business. States will finally have a clear definition of where federal jurisdiction ends & begins, as well as the ability to properly manage their own water.

html: Instead of attempting to needlessly regulate every puddle, ditch, and furrow in America, the new rule will focus on bodies of water and wetlands that are physically and meaningfully connected to other bodies of jurisdictional water.
text: Instead of attempting to needlessly regulate every puddle, ditch, and furrow in America, the new rule will focus on bodies of water and wetlands that are physically and meaningfully connected to other bodies of jurisdictional water.

html: I joined @SecretaryZinke, @SecretarySonny, & the @USDA to host a roundtable discussion with California producers and ag workers. html: Surface storage projects like this one are absolutely critical to securing the future of our state’s water supply. We know all too well the potential economic impacts of a drought, and Sites Reservoir will enable more water storage during wet years in preparation for dry years.pic.twitter.com/KecNGxSzRI
text: Surface storage projects like this one are absolutely critical to securing the future of our state’s water supply. html: Today, @USDA announced a $449 million loan to Sites Reservoir Project Authority to build the interconnection facilities to move water in and out of Sites Reservoir. This is a project that I’ve been fighting to see completed since I’ve been in Congress.pic.twitter.com/jvIjGgTWYJ
text: Today, @USDA announced a $449 million loan to Sites Reservoir Project Authority to build the interconnection facilities to move water in and out of Sites Reservoir. This is a project that I’ve been fighting to see completed since I’ve been in Congress.pic.twitter.com/jvIjGgTWYJ

html: California is a tinderbox. Drought, warm temperatures, infestations, poor forest management, expanding wildland-urban interface, & many other factors have made the western US more prone to fire. BUT there's something we can do about it. Read ->https://www.cnn.com/2018/11/26/opinions/wildfire-prevention-goes-hand-in-hand-with-creating-jobs-zinke/index.html …

html: (4/4) No matter what causes a fire to start, a properly managed forest is far more resilient than dense, overgrown woodlands. It’s common sense, and it’s time to take decisive action to help save wildlife, property, and human lives.
text: (4/4) No matter what causes a fire to start, a properly managed forest is far more resilient than dense, overgrown woodlands. It’s common sense, and it’s time to take decisive action to help save wildlife, property, and human lives.

html: (3/4) Today, we witnessed two images that tell starkly contrasting stories – one that resembles a burnt out wasteland and one of a minimally damaged, healthy forest. It’s no coincidence – it’s the difference between land that is responsibly thinned, and land that is not.
text: (3/4) Today, we witnessed two images that tell starkly contrasting stories – one that resembles a burnt out wasteland and one of a minimally damaged, healthy forest. It’s no coincidence – it’s the difference between land that is responsibly thinned, and land that is not.

html: (4/5) On November 11, Governor Brown requested a Federal Major Disaster Declaration from President Trump. These declarations have a great deal of paperwork and typically can take a few days to grant.
text: (4/5) On November 11, Governor Brown requested a Federal Major Disaster Declaration from President Trump.  These declarations have a great deal of paperwork and typically can take a few days to grant.

html: (3/5) Later on November 8th, Acting Governor Newsom requested a Presidential Emergency Declaration for Direct Assistance for Wildfires. President Trump approved the Emergency Declaration November 9th while in route to France.
text: (3/5) Later on November 8th, Acting Governor Newsom requested a Presidential Emergency Declaration for Direct Assistance for Wildfires. President Trump approved the Emergency Declaration November 9th while in route to France.

html: (2/5) Early on November 8th, a Fire Management Assistance Grant (FMAG) was granted by (FEMA) to help ensure the availability of vital resources to suppress the Camp Fire burning in Butte County. The FMAG also enables local, state and tribal agencies to recover eligible costs.
text: (2/5) Early on November 8th, a Fire Management Assistance Grant (FMAG) was granted by (FEMA) to help ensure the availability of vital resources to suppress the Camp Fire burning in Butte County. The FMAG also enables local, state and tribal agencies to recover eligible costs.

text:
